basics.name: Adam Aufderheide
basics.label: Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineer
basics.summary: Undergraduate researcher and engineer specializing in aerospace design, automation, and navigation systems with experience in CAD, programming, and electrical system design.

work.name: Purdue Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
work.summary: Synthesized LROC image data in Blender to design a high-fidelity 3D model of the moon. Developed automated pipelines for visual navigation testing using MATLAB, Python, and Blender. Simulated spacecraft landings and applied vSLAM algorithms for localization and mapping. Wrote Gaussian mixture fusion algorithms for distributed navigation in Python.
highlights: 3D moon modeling using Blender and LROC data
Applied vSLAM for extraterrestrial terrain mapping

work.name: Komatsu Mining
work.summary: Prototyped and tested modular sensor platforms integrating radar, lidar, GPS, and cameras for autonomous vehicles. Designed custom sensor mounts and PCBs. Developed electrical system architecture for power, safety, and compute integration. Collaborated across teams to validate hardware integration.
highlights: Mechanical and electrical prototyping for autonomous vehicle sensors

skills.name: Skills
keywords: Proficient in CAD modeling software: Solidworks, NX, Autodesk Inventor, Autodesk Fusion 360, and others
Experienced in Finite Element Analysis (FEA) simulations
Skilled in PLM/PDM workflows and technical writing standards
Programming languages: MATLAB, Python, C; experienced with Git workflows
Operate 3D printing, laser cutting, and CNC machines efficiently
Familiar with manufacturing standards and techniques
Experienced in electrical system design, circuitry, schematic reading/writing, and PCB design
Problem solving, root-cause analysis, failure analysis, and iterative design

projects.name: Purdue Space Program (Students for the Exploration and Development of Space)
projects.summary: Worked on liquid rocketry team to develop motor and fin support structures and injector design. Performed Finite Element Analysis to simulate stress and optimize CAD models.
highlights: Rocket motor and fin structural design
Finite Element Analysis for stress and weight optimization

projects.name: FIRST Robotics Team 8680
projects.position: Team Captain and Mechanical Design Lead
projects.summary: Led design and prototyping of autonomous and driver-controlled robots using advanced sensors and odometry. Managed a 15-member team and mentored over 50 students. Secured ~$100k in sponsorships and achieved top rankings in world competitions.

interests.name: Aerospace Engineering & Space Exploration
keywords: Spacecraft attitude dynamics and control systems
